src:
Največji konkurent Facebooka z lastnim telefonom!

05 Nov 2019, 07:41

Družbena omrežja so postala nekakšen nadomestek resničnega življenja, kar še posebej drži za trenutno najbolj priljubljeno družbeno omrežje na svetu, Facebook. Uporabniki Facebook večinoma uporabljamo za povezovanje s prijatelji in domačimi ter za prebiranje zanimivih novic. Ker pa je ta bil že večkrat zasačen pri zlorabi osebnih podatkov uporabnikov, ti neprestano iščejo zamenjavo zanj in kot vse kaže so ga našli v kitajskem družbenem omrežju TikTok. Kitajska mobilna aplikacija TikTok je bila namreč prenesena že več kot milijardo krat na pametne mobilne telefone in tablične računalnike, vendar ta številka sploh ne vključuje uporabnike mobilnih naprav Android na Kitajskem.
Družbeno omrežje TikTok (https://www.tiktok.com/) uporabnikom omogoča hitro in enostavno objavo kratkih videoposnetkov ter dodajanje učinkov in filtrov. Zato ne preseneča, da je to še posebej priljubljeno med mlajšimi uporabniki, ki vse bolj množično zapuščajo družbeno omrežje Facebook. Novo družbeno omrežje je trenutno še posebej priljubljeno v azijski regiji, zanj pa se vse bolj zanimajo tudi Evropejci in Američani, kar še posebno drži za mlajše uporabnike in tiste, ki jim Facebook preprosto ni po godu.
Da pa bi bila izkušnja z družbenim omrežjem TikTok še boljša, je podjetje ByteDance zanje pripravilo namenski pametni mobilni telefon s prodajno oznako Smartisan Nut Pro 3. Tu lahko namreč aplikacijo TikTok prikličemo kar s potegom prsta, privzeto pa so na voljo tudi različni filtri za videoposnetke. Čeprav gre tu za namenski pametnih mobilni telefon, je ta nadvse zmogljiv.
Strojna oprema pametnega mobilnega telefona Smartisan Nut Pro 3 namreč obsega mobilni procesor Snapdragon 855 Plus, osem oziroma 12 gigabajtov sistemskega pomnilnika (odvisno od različice) in vgrajeni pomnilnik s 128 gigabajti oziroma 256 gigabajti prostora za shranjevanje podatkov. Za dovolj dolgo avtonomijo delovanja pa skrbi baterija zmogljivosti 4.000 miliamper ur. Vstopna različica novosti na kitajskem trgu ni niti pretirano draga, saj jo trgovci vrednotijo na preračunanih 370 evrov.



Povezave: ByteDance
text:
Facebook's biggest competitor with your own phone!

05 Nov 2019, 07:41

Social networks have become a sort of substitute for real life, which is especially true of the current most popular social network in the world, Facebook. We mostly use Facebook users to connect with friends and family and read interesting news. However, since it has been repeatedly caught in the misuse of personal data of users, they are constantly looking for a replacement for it and, as it seems, have found it on the Chinese social network TikTok. The Chinese mobile application TikTok has been downloaded more than a billion times on smartphones and tablets, but this number does not include Android mobile users in China at all.
The TikTok social network (https://www.tiktok.com/) allows users to post short videos quickly and easily and add effects and filters. So it's no surprise that this is especially popular with younger users who are increasingly leaving the social networking site of Facebook. The new social network is currently particularly popular in the Asian region, and is increasingly interested in Europeans and Americans, which is especially true for younger users and those who just don't like Facebook.
To make the TikTok social networking experience even better, ByteDance has created a dedicated smart phone with the trademark Smartisan Nut Pro 3 for them. The TikTok app can be called here by the swipe of a finger, and by default various video filters are also available. . Although this is a dedicated smart cell phone, it is extremely powerful.
Smartisan Nut Pro 3 smartphone hardware includes a Snapdragon 855 Plus mobile processor, eight or 12 gigabytes of system memory (depending on version) and built-in memory of 128 gigabytes or 256 gigabytes of storage. A long enough battery life is guaranteed by a 4,000 milliamp hour battery. The entry-level version of the novelty on the Chinese market is not too expensive either, as traders value it at a recalculated $ 370.



Links: ByteDance
